title: Trott and Afghanistan to part ways after 2026 T20 World Cup
byline: Former England batter Jonathan Trott will leave his job as head coach of Afghanistan after next year’s men’s T20 World Cup.

title: FIFA dismisses Malaysia appeals in forgery scandal
byline: FIFA on Monday announced it had dismissed the appeals lodged by Malaysia’s football federation (FAM) and its seven players in the on-going eligibility scandal linked to forged documents used for an Asia Cup qualifier.

title: Key records broken by champions India in CWC25 final
byline: India’s first-ever ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup triumph saw several records tumble in a clinical display against South Africa.

title: India announces $5.75 million reward for women cricket World Cup winners
byline: India’s cricket board on Monday announced a cash reward of $5.75 million for the women’s team after their triumphant World Cup campaign.

title: SC grants leave to proceed with schoolgirl’s petition over Punjabi dress ban
byline: The Supreme Court today granted leave to proceed with a Fundamental Rights petition filed by a schoolgirl challenging the decision of her school administration to prohibit her wearing the Punjabi dress to school.

title: Former football star David Beckham awarded knighthood
byline: David Beckham has received a knighthood from King Charles at Windsor Castle today.

title: State officials should be handled with diligence: Wajira
byline: State officials should be handled with diligence, especially in a situation where they are not appreciated whenever their actions benefit the country and blamed during other instances where they are blamed when the state suffers losses because of them, UNP Chairman Wajira Abeywardena said today.

title: Zimbabwe stalwart Williams loses contract after entering drug rehab
byline: Zimbabwe all-rounder Sean Williams, one of the country’s finest ever cricketers, will no longer be considered for selection after he entered into a drug rehabilitation programme, Zimbabwe Cricket (ZC) said in a statement on Tuesday.

title: Former US Vice President Dick Cheney dead at 84
byline: Former United States Vice President Dick Cheney has died aged 84.

title: Income tax filing deadline set for November 30
byline: The Inland Revenue Department has announced that all individuals registered for Income Tax are required to submit their Income Tax Returns for the Year of Assessment 2024/2025 online on or before November 30, 2025.

title: Schengen visa appointments only through VFS Global
byline: The German Embassy in Sri Lanka has announced that, effective from November 3, 2025, all appointments for Schengen visa applications must be made through a new online system operated by VFS Global.

title: CSE touches 23,000 milestone amid volatile trading session
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) experienced a volatile yet positive session today, as the All-Share Price Index (ASPI) briefly surpassed the 23,000 mark during early trading hours. However, profit-taking emerged later in the day, pulling back gains and leaving the index to close modestly higher.

title: Former Finance Secretary Charitha Ratwatte granted bail
byline: Former Finance Ministry Secretary Charitha Ratwatte, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) was released on bail over allegations of causing a financial loss of Rs. 99.6 million to the government by importing 50 temporary paddy storage units in violation of due procedures during his tenure as a senior advisor to former Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Sabalenka to face Kyrgios in 'Battle of Sexes'
byline: World number one Aryna Sabalenka will face Nick Kyrgios in a ’Battle of the Sexes’ exhibition match in the United Arab Emirates later this year.

title: Four arrested over Fisheries Corporation corruption case
byline: Four individuals, including a former Chairman of the Lanka Fisheries Corporation, have been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) over an irregular equipment purchase made in 2020.

title: Bus conductor arrested over assault at Galle Face
byline: A 35-year-old bus conductor has been arrested in connection with the assault of an individual in the Galle Face area in Fort, a video of which has been widely circulated on social media.

title: Kerala declares itself extreme-poverty free, first state in India to do so
byline: Kerala chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan formally announced in the state assembly on Saturday and that the state has eradicated extreme poverty. The LDF government claims Kerala is the first state in India to do so.

title: Anger mounts over Customs delay on BYD vehicle release
byline: A group of individuals staged a protest in Colombo today (04) demanding the immediate release of BYD vehicles currently detained by Sri Lanka Customs.

title: Kelaniya University researchers develop new drug to control high blood pressure
byline: The Clinical Research Unit of the Faculty of Medicine, University of Kelaniya, has developed a breakthrough drug that can significantly reduce high blood pressure.

title: Cabinet nod to halt new wind power projects on Mannar Island
byline: Cabinet of Ministers have decided to agree to the President’s directive not to implement the wind projects without the consent of the people living in the Mannar Island.

title: Vatican willing to work with SL in meeting international challenges: Archbishop Paul Gallagher
byline: The Vatican is looking towards working with Sri Lanka in meeting international challenges and enhancing bilateral ties with Sri Lanka, visiting Vatican Secretary for Relations with States and International Organisations, Archbishop Paul Richard Gallagher said today.

title: Cabinet approves recruitment of women for key Railway positions
byline: For the first time in Sri Lanka’s 165-year railway history, women will be allowed to apply for key operational positions such as Railway Engine Driver, Train Controller, Station Master, and Railway Supervisory Manager, following a Cabinet decision.

title: STF to get motorcycles and Tuk-Tuks to boost anti-drug raids
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal by the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs to purchase 100 motorcycles with 125cc engine capacity and 50 tuk-tuks for the Special Task Force (STF).

title: Sajith Premadasa meets Indian Finance Minister in New Delhi
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa met India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman at the Ministry of Finance in New Delhi for discussions on deepening bilateral economic cooperation and regional integration.

title: Tickets to go on sale for ODI series between Pakistan and Sri Lanka from Tuesday
byline: Tickets for the three-match ODI series between Pakistan and Sri Lanka will go on sale online from 12 pm on Tuesday, 4 November.

title: ’Wicked’ star Jonathan Bailey named ’sexiest man alive’
byline: English actor Jonathan Bailey, who returns to movie theaters this month in the musical film ’’Wicked: For Good,’’ was named this year’s ’’sexiest man alive’’ by People magazine on Monday.

title: Tamil Nadu CM urges Jaishankar to ensure release of detained fishermen in Sri Lanka
byline: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin wrote a letter to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, urging him to initiate immediate diplomatic efforts with the Sri Lankan Government to secure the release of all detained fishermen from Tamil Nadu along with their fishing boats.

title: Life threats to MP Adaikkalanathan, complaint lodged with Jaffna Police
byline: Member of Parliament Selvam Adaikkalanathan has lodged a complaint with the Jaffna Police, stating that he has received death threats.

title: TPA will not participate in the joint opposition rally: Mano
byline: The Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) will not participate in the joint opposition rally which is to be held in Nugegoda on November 21, its leader Mano Ganesan said.

title: Update: Businessman killed in Ambalangoda shooting
byline: A businessman who was injured in a shooting near the Ambalangoda Urban Council premises this morning (4) has succumbed to his injuries.

title: Soldier killed, three injured in brick-wall collapse
byline: An army soldier was killed and three others injured when a brick-wall of an abandoned building at 59th Brigade Camp at Mulliyaweli in Mullaitivu collapsed on them.

title: Former Finance Secretary Charitha Ratwatte arrested
byline: Former Secretary to the Ministry of Finance and Senior Advisor to the former Prime Minister, Charitha Ratwatte, was arrested today by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: ASPI surpasses 23,000 milestone, fueling investor optimism
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) continued its bullish momentum as the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassed the 23,000 mark, reflecting growing investor confidence and sustained market optimism.

title: Over 100,000 houses built with mud, rocks, and thatched with Palmyra leaves, cadjan or straw
byline: Over 100,000 houses in Sri Lanka currently have been built using mud and rocks for walls and roofed with Palmyra leaves, cadjan or straws, highlighting the lack of weather–prone housing conditions, according to the Department of Census and Statistics (DCS).
